resources.string: You are trying to change your favorite routine. Are you sure?
Here, you can manage all your routines:
you can create a new one (button near the information one)
you can modify already present routines (button at the right of the screen)
you can play a routine (button play)
you can delete a routine (swipe on the routine name from left to right).
The record highlighted is your current favorite routine. You can change it: if you press and hold on the name of a routine, that routine will be the new favorite routine.

Welcome! This app will be an helpful tool for your workouts. You can create your exercises and group them in routines, then you can play routines through the timer and manage your time during workout.
If you press \"Play workout\", it will start your favorite routine.
If you press \"Manager workout\", it will start the routines explorer and you will see all your routines.
If you \"Show exercises\", it will start the exercises explorer that shows all exercises created.
Press \"About\" to discover more information about the developer of this app.
In every activity you can find more specific information.

This is the timer that play the routine. If you have pressed \"Play workout\" in the main activity, here it is played your favorite routine. In the other cases you have pressed a play button somewhere in the application to play a specific routine.

Here, with a simple touch you can play/pause the timer, skip to previous/next phase of the exercise. Instead, if you want to skip to previous/next exercise of the routine, you have to touch and hold the buttons \"prev\" and \"next\". The lock button disables the other buttons of the gui (so the timer never stop for an accidental touch)

At the top, it is displayed the exercise\'s name and under it the total countdown of the entire routine, in seconds. In the center, it is displayed the countdown of the current exercise phase, in seconds. At the left-bottom, it is displayed the number of sets to do for the current exercise. At the right-bottom, it is displayed the number of repetitions to do for the current exercise.
Here, you can manage a routine. In the bar menu, from to right, the buttons perform: save changes, play the selected routine.

Under the menu you have the routine name and you can modify the name itself, but remember: every routine must have an UNIQUE name. Next to the routine name, there is the \"add\" button: you can add exercises to your routine. If you want to delete an exercise from the routine, swipe on the exercise name from left to right.

In every row, you can see some information about every exercise (name, sets to do, repetitions to do, work time, rest time). You can manage and modify the single exercise touching the respective button on the right of the screen.
The visual order of the exercises will be the playing order for the timer. You can change the order: press and hold on the name of an exercise and drag and drop where you want.
Here you can manage all your exercises.

In the menu there is the \"new exercise\" button. The buttons at the right permit you to modify the selected exercise. If you want to delete an exercise from the all app (and all routines), swipe on the exercise name from left to right.
For every exercise you can see name, sets to do, repetitions to do, work time, rest time.
Here, you can set all the parameters of an exercise: name (remember that name must be UNIQUE), preparation time, work time, rest time, cool down time, sets to do and repetitions to do.
The structure of an exercise is: preparationTime (WorkTime Rest)*(setsToDo - 1) WorkTime CoolDownTime

In every respective field you can set the duration of every phase, sets to do and reps to do. If the button on the left displays \"disable\", then the timer will do the corresponding count down, otherwise the timer won\'t do the count down, but it will await your command (on \"next\" button\), to go on.
Don\'t joke me! You have to do at least on set!
Do you really want to exit the activity? All unsaved data will be lost!
The routine you selected don\'t have exercises to be played
You have completed the workout. Are you ready for the next one?
